title: Riot, we'll still love you, you can admit you made a mistake
body:
To begin, I'm a pretty casual Boards user. usually just stop by to check out updates etc. I was pretty active on the old Forums though

But lately, whether I visit once a day, or once a week, this season all I'm seeing is frustration at Dynamic Queue. And it's justified
Riot, we know you guys are gamers, and WE know that YOU know what makes games inherently fun. 

I am NOT knocking on League of Legends. Since season 3 when I started, I have LOVED league of legends. For about 90% of my time playing. Unfortunately season 6 is the 10%. I don't even care about balance at this point, It's really just Dynamic Queue

Games are meant to empower a player. Whether it's living out a fantasy or just feeling strong. This has always been a struggle in league, playing with 5 strangers and having to work together to win? Sometimes you can feel helpless but the cooperation can be rewarding, and it's a cool challenge. Now it's just a struggle. Feeling totally helpless. At the disposal of premades that you can't handle and defeat as opponents. And, that you can't work with as teammates, often the victim of abuse. Feeling powerless, helpless, weak, whatever you want to call it, is what every player does NOT want. If you're concerned about Solo players being "the most toxic", congratulations - now they're constantly mad and it's going to be a lot worse! But the helplessness doesn't stop when the game ends. Good luck attemtping to root out toxicity when a solo player will get slammed with 4 reports for disagreeing with their 4 man premade temamates, or just feeding. 

I mean, you're just being hypocritical. You CONSTANTLY say how your main goal when tuning a champion is making them feel strong. So how can you be comfortable with making the PLAYER feel weak?

It isn't healthy and we don't like it, you can admit it. You made a mistake but we'll still love you Riot, if you just acknowledge it and listen to people. I'm not even saying remove Dynamic, just make Solo Q a choice again, if possible  {{sticker:slayer-jinx-wink}}

EDIT
Apparently some people actually think it's a non factor? Well I'll begin with a fact I guess

Superior communication and coordination is a direct advantage in a MOBA. This is not debatable

The entire point of solo q was to overcome the challenge of lack of communication, and to work as a team to be successful. This is gone. And no, 2 duos were not the same as a 4 man premade

I mean, I don't play ranked much, I'm silver 3. Last year I was almost gold and 75% of players I play with right now have the gold border. At this silver/gold level, early leads OFTEN win. 

When I see a team rotate perfectly, take dragon, and then push down mid lane 12 minutes in, it's blatantly obvious it's a premade. Players at this level cannot coordinate objective control as fast or effectively. And at this level, and shit, even at the LCS level, a major early lead can win the game

And that's exactly what happens. It's SO easy for premades to faceroll a team simply because their coordination allows them to take an early lead and capitalize on their advantage. Contesting dragon, splitting top after taking Rift, rotating bot/mid, calling out summoner and cooldowns, coordinating ganks. Sure a duo is an advantage, but 4? The synchronization is simply unfair

Don't get me wrong, it's awesome, but there's a place for it.

Ranked 5s

+ **Apparently this post is rude and condescending.**

Look, It's not out of stubbornness or selfishness that I ask this
The system of choosing to play either solo/duo, or choosing to play as a full team of 5 has been PERFECTLY FINE for the last I don't even know how many years. I have nothing against premades, they just don't belong in the same games as players who wish to play solo as they have for _years_. I'll say it again, **it belongs in Ranked 5's
**
I've seen several "Dynamic Queue was a great fix" Alright, but **_NOTHING WAS BROKEN_**
New Champ select? AWESOME fix. Dynamic Queue? Not necessary

i didn't have any problems with riot until this season

in fact i LOVED riot. all the work they did was awesome, and they still do some awesome stuff, but at this point i'm more frustrated with the game than anything and i can't enjoy it even with the positive parts of league.

but i mean, you have to give riot some credit.

* they made the game much easier for new players, reducing the cost of runes to ONE ip, and cutting the amount of xp required to hit lv 30 in half.


* they put out fun game modes all the time


* they used to only give out free rewards on good behavior once a year, now with hextech crafting, as long as you're not an asshole you can get free skins, champs, icons, ward skins, etc. really regularly. sure, the lack of keys might be a cash grab, but i can guarantee everyone has gotten at least one skin completely free


* the art teams never EVER disappoint, only exception was the new SKT skins, and they said they were going to release them later in the year so they have time to put out a better final product. they made a mistake, and they went back to fix it. the rest of the skins, music, login screen animations, champ designs..... i have absolutely no complaints, they're all amazing.


* the client is a LOT more stable than it was when i first started playing. bugsplats used to be pretty common.


* the visual update for SR is amazing

these are just some things off the top of my head.

riot does great work. i genuinely enjoyed this game before this season, but there have been too many changes, and i don't see the point in playing ranked anymore. i know it sounds like minor things, but dynamic queue has completely demotivated me in every way. it's sad really, i want to enjoy this game again. 

riot please give us solo players something to work with.

The problem is how slowly they get things done though.
The thing you underestimate is that Riot's PR strategy seems to be, "We know we made a mistake, but don't worry, our next mistake will fix that."

Someone at Riot has put their ego and career on the line with the dynamic Q. This crap won't go away for a while unfortunately.

This is like Blizzard and the whole Diablo 3 real money auction house thing. It took a while before they admitted they fucked up and Jay Wilson had to step down.

That's the problem with games and their communities. The community thinks they are in control when they are not..... especially when it comes to a free game. You can cry about the changes all you want but the game states before you play you must agree to the TOS before you play. In this agreement it states they are free to change their game any way they want, even discontinue the service.

In the end the choices that are made is in Riot's full control. We as the players do not have a say in how they want their game to develop into a permanent esport. Yeah we may voice our concerns, give them suggestions, which again in the TOS states they can take your suggestions freely and use them, but ultimately the decisions they make is theirs. 

No one is going to like change. Ever. But you're going to have to deal with it or leave the game for another. And before people jump on what I have to say, you can go ahead and keep voicing your concerns, no one is saying you can't. What is being said is you don't have control, influence or the means to pushing Riot into doing the things you want for a game that you agreed you have no control over with the TOS.

As for what I think. Both queues are kind of garbage, I don't think one is better over the other. It's kind of clear that the old queue had more ways to troll but neither dealt with AFKs or whining kids in general. You know the type of people who attack others for mistakes when they make the same if not more amount of mistakes in the same game. These kind of dumb kids need to leave or grow up.

We are their source of income

Currently, I'm playing competitively significantly less, and I'm considering dropping league.

Upvoted bring back soloQ, dynamicQ make no sense in term of a mathematical ranking queue, you can't get any numbers about your performance since its all about the premades.

Sigh.

Does that suck? Yes. Do I prefer solo queue? Again, yes. (Haven't touched ranked yet. Was waiting for true solo queue) But let's not kid ourselves into thinking dynamic queue is a failure at large.

Let me tell you what exactly changed in ranked: Nothing. People make a giant out of a mouse there. It's not even halfway as bad as people make it sound like.

There is no difference between getting matched with a 4 man premade or 2 duos. And generally speaking premades aren't worse/better than the league they are in. Or flame more/less. Most of what the common boards users complain about is just negativity bias. They don't remember when they had friendly premades and only remember the toxic ones.

I mean, 4 people working together is 80% of a team. Not hard for the 5th to drag along

When you find yourself scrambling to get your random teammates to focus on objectives while the other team has begun outrotating you and coordinating objectives like dragons and early turrets, it's very easy to get quite behind quite fast

At my elo, teams lose hope fast. Early leads often win games so to be honest, most games against 4 man premades are just a fucking stomp. And the reverse when I happen to be with one. Not healthy

I love how so many people say ranked is meaningless this patch and it's so terrible of a system. Their main argument is boosting. How many people are boosted? I've never seen statistics. is it 1/100? 1/1000? They just state their rank is meaningless because omg everyone is boosting up to diamond. 

Do you even know how the system works? Up to a certain point you can only play with someone a tier away from you. So if your are silver you can only with with golds or bronze. I don't see how a silver playing with golds is boosting. Above plat it's even less than that because they start limiting it by divisions.

Even with those restrictions matchmaking tries to balance out teams from there. So if you are gold and play with a silver, the enemy team will most likely have a silver also.

there's more to boosting now, its not simply being carried, you can have 3 people work well together but are mediocre separate, say a top, mid, jg they feed off each other ganks and what not, then when they play alone they don't get a baby sitter or someone to give them kills to help back in the game, or lets say they just have one good player who can carry the other 2, i know plenty of people that have been silver for a couple seasons, but now they are mid gold easy because of  DQ, and no they haven't got any better i know the players that are carrying  them, DQ is garbage system for a competitive ladder even on paper is doesn't make any sense, then include the fact that literally relies on solo players who only want to play alone, it alienates millions of players while using them to make larger amount of players happy, needs of the many outweigh the needs of the few until the few leave and take many with them.
